org.letras.ps.rawdata
Interface IPenDriver

All Known Implementing Classes:
AnotoPenDriver, LogitechPenDriver, NokiaPenDriver, NokiaPenDriver
public interface IPenDriver

This interface must be provided by the main class of each pen driver. Its implementation has to be specified as pen driver main class in the pen driver manifest. It is this implementation, that will be instantiated by the PenDriverManager in order to fire up a new pen driver.

Implementing classes need to provide a nullary constructor in order to support instantiation. However, it might obtain needed properties in form of a org.mundo.rt.TypedMap and set it parameters accordingly. Refer to the plugin.xml description for details.

A driver is usually packaged as a jar-file containing one main class implementing this interface, which is specified as such in the plugin.xml file. Details can be found in the wiki documentation. If a pen driver needs configuration options (properties), these options might be passed using the same mechanism as a mundo service: by implementing the IConfigure interface. Such options are passed as map inside the driver xml file.

The contract for the procedure to fire up a driver is as follows:

  1. The driver is instantiated using its nullary constructor
  2. If the driver implements the org.mundo.service.IConfigure interface and the drivers plugin.xml file provides configuration data, this data is passed as a TypedMap to the driver (via a call to the setServiceConfig() method)
  3. The appropriate IPenAdapterFactory is set via a call to the inject() method
  4. The init() method is called -- from now on the driver will be expected to work properly
To shutdown a running pen driver, the shutdown() method will be called before deleting any remaining references and waiting for the garbage collector to set in.

Version:
0.0.1
Author:
felix_h

Method Summary
 void init()
          Called to initialize the pen driver.
 void inject(IPenAdapterFactory factory)
          Injection method invoked by the pen driver manager to set the currently used pen adapter factory.
 void shutdown()
          Called to finalize the pen driver.
 

Method Detail

inject

void inject(IPenAdapterFactory factory)
Injection method invoked by the pen driver manager to set the currently used pen adapter factory. The contract is that this method will be called before the init() method will be called. So upon initialization, the pen driver will already know the factory it should use. NOTE As of version v0.1.x of this interface, no runtime change in the used factory is foreseen, so the inject method will be called only once when the driver is initialized

Parameters:
factory - the pen adapter factory to use for obtaining pen adapters

init

void init()
Called to initialize the pen driver. The contract is that this method will be called after the pen adapter factory has been injected, to allow the pen driver to setup its needed classes. If this pen driver also implements the IConfigure interface, the setServiceConfig() will also be called prior to this init method, i.e. the implementor will have the configuration options readily available whenever the init method is called.

shutdown

void shutdown()
Called to finalize the pen driver. Prior to shutting down the pen driver, this method will be called in order to allow the pen driver to finalize its used resources and shut them down cleanly. After calling this method the framework will delete the reference to the pen driver.
